result.execSummary:
The defendant Obadiah D Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay fine of $ 500.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Perform 80 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May Not have contact with Steven B unless otherwise permitted by the court.DE may expunge his record in 2 years if he successfully completes all conditions of probation and financial obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Obadiah D Bennett

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular
Email correspondence received from Agent Angel stating DE has paid his financial obligations in full so there is no longer need for a probation review hearing on 9/2/16.

Agent Angel is unavailable for the review hearing on 9/2/16 so she has been instructed to submit a memo to the court prior to the hearing and court will then waive her appearance since this case does not involve restitution.
Probation review hearing on September 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared specially for Attorney Mike Graveley and for the State. Defendant, Obadiah D Bennett, appeared with Attorney Lauren Jane Breckenfelder.   Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 6 months with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 80 days of Community Service.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of 500 plus costs & surcharges to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE may expunge his record in 2 years if he successfully completes all conditions of probation and financial obligations.  Appeal Rights given.
Filed by Atty: L Breckenfelder
